00021 #include <stdio.h>
00022 
00023 #include "test-harness.h"
00024 
00025 #include "dbprim.h"
00026 #include "dbprim_int.h"
00027 
00028 RCSTAG("@(#)$Id$");
00029 
00030 TEST_PROG(t_linklists, "Test linked list functionality")
00031 
00032 struct tdata_s {
00033   link_loc_t    loc;
00034   int           elem;
00035 } tdata[] = {
00036   { LINK_LOC_HEAD, -1 },
00037   { LINK_LOC_HEAD, -1 },
00038   { LINK_LOC_TAIL, -1 },
00039   { LINK_LOC_TAIL, -1 },
00040   { LINK_LOC_BEFORE, 0 },
00041   { LINK_LOC_AFTER, 2 }
00042 };
00043 
00044 #define LINK_ELEM_CNT   (sizeof(tdata) / sizeof(struct tdata_s))
00045 
00046 int order_add[] = { 1, 4, 0, 2, 5, 3, -1 };
00047 
00048 struct tmove_s {
00049   int           elem;
00050   link_loc_t    loc;
00051   int           elem2;
00052 } tmove[] = {
00053   { 2, LINK_LOC_HEAD, -1 },
00054   { 0, LINK_LOC_TAIL, -1 },
00055   { 5, LINK_LOC_AFTER, 2 },
00056   { 4, LINK_LOC_BEFORE, 0 }
00057 };
00058 
00059 #define LINK_MOVE_CNT   (sizeof(tmove) / sizeof(struct tmove_s))
00060 
00061 int order_move[] = { 2, 5, 1, 3, 4, 0, -1 };
00062 
00063 int tremove[] = { 2, 0, 3 };
00064 
00065 #define LINK_REMOVE_CNT (sizeof(tremove) / sizeof(int))
00066 
00067 int order_remove[] = { 5, 1, 4, -1 };
00068 
00069 static unsigned long
00070 t_comp(db_key_t *key, void *comp)
00071 {
00072   return dk_len(key) != (int)comp;
00073 }
00074 
00075 struct iter_desc {
00076   int           elem;
00077   unsigned long err;
00078   int           start;
00079   unsigned long flags;
00080   unsigned long visited;
00081   unsigned long expected;
00082 };
00083 
00084 static unsigned long
00085 t_iter(link_head_t *head, link_elem_t *elem, void *extra)
00086 {
00087   struct iter_desc *desc = (struct iter_desc *)extra;
00088 
00089   desc->visited |= 1 << (int)le_object(elem); /* mark that we visited node */
00090 
00091   /* return the error we want for testing... */
00092   return ((int)le_object(elem) == desc->elem) ? desc->err : 0;
00093 }
00094 
00095 struct iter_desc desc_iter[] = {
00096   { 1, 55, -1, 0, 0, (1 << 5) | (1 << 1) },
00097   { -1, 55, -1, 0, 0, (1 << 5) | (1 << 1) | (1 << 4) },
00098   { 1, 55, -1, DB_FLAG_REVERSE, 0, (1 << 4) | (1 << 1) },
00099   { -1, 55, -1, DB_FLAG_REVERSE, 0, (1 << 4) | (1 << 1) | (1 << 5) },
00100   { 1, 55, 1, 0, 0, (1 << 1) }
00101 };
00102 
00103 #define LINK_ITER_CNT   (sizeof(desc_iter) / sizeof(struct iter_desc))
00104 
00105 struct iter_desc desc_flush[] = {
00106   { 1, 55, -1, 0, 0, (1 << 5) | (1 << 1) },
00107   { -1, 55, -1, 0, 0, (1 << 4) }
00108 };
00109 
00110 int order_flush[][2] = {
00111   { 4, -1 },
00112   { -1, -1 }
00113 };
00114 
00115 #define LINK_FLUSH_CNT  (sizeof(desc_flush) / sizeof(struct iter_desc))
00116 
00117 #define ChkOrder(name, order, fatal, go)                                      \
00118 do {                                                                          \
00119   int _err = 0;                                                               \
00120   char *_name = TEST_NAME(name);                                              \
00121   int *_order = (order);                                                      \
00122   link_elem_t *_le = ll_first(&head), *_ple = ll_first(&head);                \
00123   for (; *_order >= 0 && _le; _order++, _ple = _le, _le = le_next(_le))       \
00124     if (_le != &elems[*_order]) {                                             \
00125       _err++;                                                                 \
00126       fprintf(stderr, "%s ordering error: Expected %d, got %d\n", _name,      \
00127               *_order, _le - elems);                                          \
00128     }                                                                         \
00129   if (_err) {                                                                 \
00130     FAIL(_name, (fatal), "Ordering failure: %d errors", _err);                \
00131     go                                                                        \
00132   } else if (*_order != -1 || _le != 0 || _ple != ll_last(&head)) {           \
00133     FAIL(_name, (fatal), "List incorrectly terminated");                      \
00134     go                                                                        \
00135   }                                                                           \
00136 } while (0)
00137 
00138 int
00139 main(int argc, char **argv)
00140 {
00141   unsigned long err;
00142   link_head_t head; /* a linked list to play with... */
00143   link_elem_t elems[LINK_ELEM_CNT]; /* some elements to operate on... */
00144   link_elem_t *le = 0;
00145   db_key_t tkey = DB_KEY_INIT(0, 1);
00146   int i;
00147 
00148   /* First, test ll_init()... */
00149   TEST(t_linklists, ll_init, "Test that ll_init() may be called",
00150        (!(err = ll_init(&head, 0))), FATAL(0),
00151        ("ll_init() call successful"),
00152        ("ll_init() call failed with error %lu", err));
00153 
00154   /* Now, check le_init()... */
00155   TEST_DECL(t_linklists, le_init, "Test that le_init() may be called")
00156   for (i = 0; i < LINK_ELEM_CNT; i++)
00157     if ((err = le_init(&elems[i], (void *)i)))
00158       FAIL(TEST_NAME(le_init), FATAL(0), "le_init() failed with error %lu",
00159            err);
00160   PASS(TEST_NAME(le_init), "le_init() calls successful");
00161 
00162   /* OK, does ll_add() work correctly? */
00163   TEST_DECL(t_linklists, ll_add, "Test that ll_add() works properly")
00164   for (i = 0; i < LINK_ELEM_CNT; i++)
00165     if ((err = ll_add(&head, &elems[i], tdata[i].loc,
00166                       tdata[i].elem < 0 ? 0 : &elems[tdata[i].elem])))
00167       FAIL(TEST_NAME(ll_add), FATAL(0), "ll_add() failed with error %lu",
00168            err);
00169   /* check that the order is right... */
00170   ChkOrder(ll_add, order_add, FATAL(0),);
00171   PASS(TEST_NAME(ll_add), "ll_add() calls successful");
00172 
00173   /* Now let's try a few ll_move()'s... */
00174   TEST_DECL(t_linklists, ll_move, "Test that ll_move() works properly")
00175   for (i = 0; i < LINK_MOVE_CNT; i++)
00176     if ((err = ll_move(&head, &elems[tmove[i].elem], tmove[i].loc,
00177                        tmove[i].elem2 < 0 ? 0 : &elems[tmove[i].elem2])))
00178       FAIL(TEST_NAME(ll_move), FATAL(0), "ll_move() failed with error %lu",
00179            err);
00180   /* check that the order is right... */
00181   ChkOrder(ll_move, order_move, FATAL(0),);
00182   PASS(TEST_NAME(ll_move), "ll_move() calls successful");
00183 
00184   /* Now test ll_remove()... */
00185   TEST_DECL(t_linklists, ll_remove, "Test that ll_remove() works properly")
00186   for (i = 0; i < LINK_REMOVE_CNT; i++)
00187     if ((err = ll_remove(&head, &elems[tremove[i]])))
00188       FAIL(TEST_NAME(ll_remove), FATAL(0), "ll_remove() failed with error %lu",
00189            err);
00190   /* check that the order is right... */
00191   ChkOrder(ll_remove, order_remove, FATAL(0),);
00192   PASS(TEST_NAME(ll_remove), "ll_remove() calls successful");
00193 
00194   /* Let's test to see if ll_find() works... */
00195   TEST(t_linklists, ll_find, "Test that ll_find() works properly",
00196        (!(err = ll_find(&head, &le, t_comp, 0, &tkey)) &&
00197         le == &elems[dk_len(&tkey)] &&
00198         (err = ll_find(&head, &le, t_comp, &elems[4],
00199                        &tkey)) == DB_ERR_NOENTRY &&
00200         le == &elems[dk_len(&tkey)]), 0,
00201        ("ll_find() call successful"),
00202        ("ll_find() call failed or failed to find key; error %lu, elem %d (%d)",
00203         err, le ? (le - elems) : -1, dk_len(&tkey)));
00204 
00205   /* Now test ll_iter()... */
00206   TEST_DECL(t_linklists, ll_iter, "Test that ll_iter() works properly")
00207   for (i = 0; i < LINK_ITER_CNT; i++) {
00208     err = ll_iter(&head, (desc_iter[i].start < 0 ?
00209                           0 : &elems[desc_iter[i].start]),
00210                   t_iter, &desc_iter[i], desc_iter[i].flags);
00211     if (err != ((desc_iter[i].elem < 0) ? 0 : desc_iter[i].err)) {
00212       FAIL(TEST_NAME(ll_iter), 0, "ll_iter() returned unexpected error "
00213            "code %lu", err);
00214       goto iter_fail; /* yeah, yeah, I know; this is just the easiest way */
00215                       /* to get out of this loop and avoid calling PASS   */
00216                       /* that I can think of...                           */
00217     }
00218     if (desc_iter[i].visited != desc_iter[i].expected) {
00219       FAIL(TEST_NAME(ll_iter), 0, "ll_iter() failed to visit expected items; "
00220            "visited 0x%04lx, expected 0x%04lx", desc_iter[i].visited,
00221            desc_iter[i].expected);
00222       goto iter_fail;
00223     }
00224   }
00225   PASS(TEST_NAME(ll_iter), "ll_iter() calls successful");
00226  iter_fail:
00227 
00228   /* And, finally, ll_flush()... */
00229   TEST_DECL(t_linklists, ll_flush, "Test that ll_flush() works properly")
00230   for (i = 0; i < LINK_FLUSH_CNT; i++) {
00231     err = ll_flush(&head, t_iter, &desc_flush[i]);
00232     if (err != ((desc_flush[i].elem < 0) ? 0 : desc_flush[i].err)) {
00233       FAIL(TEST_NAME(ll_flush), 0, "ll_flush() returned unexpected error "
00234                      "code %lu", err);
00235       goto flush_fail; /* yeah, yeah, I know; this is just the easiest way */
00236                        /* to get out of this loop and avoid calling PASS   */
00237                        /* that I can think of...                           */
00238     }
00239     if (desc_flush[i].visited != desc_flush[i].expected) {
00240       FAIL(TEST_NAME(ll_flush), 0, "ll_flush() failed to visit expected "
00241            "items; visited 0x%04lx, expected 0x%04lx", desc_flush[i].visited,
00242            desc_iter[i].expected);
00243       goto flush_fail;
00244     }
00245     ChkOrder(ll_flush, order_flush[i], 0, goto flush_fail;);
00246   }
00247   PASS(TEST_NAME(ll_flush), "ll_flush() calls successful");
00248  flush_fail:
00249 
00250   return 0;
00251 }
